title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: members, contributors, leaders pledge make participation community harassment-free experience everyone, regardless age, body size, visible invisible disability, ethnicity, sex characteristics, gender identity expression, level experience, education, socio-economic status, nationality, personal appearance, race, caste, color, religion, sexual identity orientation. pledge act interact ways contribute open, welcoming, diverse, inclusive, healthy community.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Examples behavior contributes positive environment community include: Demonstrating empathy kindness toward people respectful differing opinions, viewpoints, experiences Giving gracefully accepting constructive feedback Accepting responsibility apologizing affected mistakes, learning experience Focusing best just us individuals, overall community Examples unacceptable behavior include: use sexualized language imagery, sexual attention advances kind Trolling, insulting derogatory comments, personal political attacks Public private harassment Publishing others’ private information, physical email address, without explicit permission conduct reasonably considered inappropriate professional setting

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community leaders responsible clarifying enforcing standards acceptable behavior take appropriate fair corrective action response behavior deem inappropriate, threatening, offensive, harmful. Community leaders right responsibility remove, edit, reject comments, commits, code, wiki edits, issues, contributions aligned Code Conduct, communicate reasons moderation decisions appropriate.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Code Conduct applies within community spaces, also applies individual officially representing community public spaces. Examples representing community include using official e-mail address, posting via official social media account, acting appointed representative online offline event.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Instances abusive, harassing, otherwise unacceptable behavior may reported community leaders responsible enforcement shaunhutch@shaw.ca, ataciuk@gmail.com, rkrishnan.arjun@gmail.com laurenzung@gmail.com. complaints reviewed investigated promptly fairly. community leaders obligated respect privacy security reporter incident.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community leaders follow Community Impact Guidelines determining consequences action deem violation Code Conduct:

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community Impact: Use inappropriate language behavior deemed unprofessional unwelcome community. Consequence: private, written warning community leaders, providing clarity around nature violation explanation behavior inappropriate. public apology may requested.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community Impact: violation single incident series actions. Consequence: warning consequences continued behavior. interaction people involved, including unsolicited interaction enforcing Code Conduct, specified period time. includes avoiding interactions community spaces well external channels like social media. Violating terms may lead temporary permanent ban.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community Impact: serious violation community standards, including sustained inappropriate behavior. Consequence: temporary ban sort interaction public communication community specified period time. public private interaction people involved, including unsolicited interaction enforcing Code Conduct, allowed period. Violating terms may lead permanent ban.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community Impact: Demonstrating pattern violation community standards, including sustained inappropriate behavior, harassment individual, aggression toward disparagement classes individuals. Consequence: permanent ban sort public interaction within community.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Code Conduct adapted Contributor Covenant, version 2.1, available https://www.contributor-covenant.org/version/2/1/code_of_conduct.html. Community Impact Guidelines inspired [Mozilla’s code conduct enforcement ladder][https://github.com/mozilla/inclusion]. answers common questions code conduct, see FAQ https://www.contributor-covenant.org/faq. Translations available https://www.contributor-covenant.org/translations.

title: Contributing to colourpickr
text: can fix typos, spelling mistakes, grammatical errors documentation directly using GitHub web interface, long changes made source file. generally means ’ll need edit roxygen2 comments .R, .Rd file. can find .R file generates .Rd reading comment first line.

title: Contributing to colourpickr
text: want make bigger change, ’s good idea first file issue make sure someone team agrees ’s needed. ’ve found bug, please file issue illustrates bug minimal reprex (also help write unit test, needed).

title: Contributing to colourpickr
text: Fork package clone onto computer. haven’t done , recommend using usethis::create_from_github("UBC-MDS/colourpickr", fork = TRUE). Install development dependencies devtools::install_dev_deps(), make sure package passes R CMD check running devtools::check(). R CMD check doesn’t pass cleanly, ’s good idea ask help continuing. Create Git branch pull request (PR). recommend using usethis::pr_init("brief-description--change"). Make changes, commit git, create PR running usethis::pr_push(), following prompts browser. title PR briefly describe change. body PR contain Fixes #issue-number. user-facing changes, add bullet top NEWS.md (.e. just first header). Follow style described https://style.tidyverse.org/news.html.

title: Contributing to colourpickr
text: New code follow tidyverse style guide. can use styler package apply styles, please don’t restyle code nothing PR. use roxygen2, Markdown syntax, documentation. use testthat unit tests. Contributions test cases included easier accept.

title: Contributing to colourpickr
text: Please note colourpickr project released Contributor Code Conduct. contributing project agree abide terms.

title: colourpickr-vignette
text: using image demonstrate various functions colourpickr package. Aerial view UBC

title: colourpickr-vignette
text: function extracts common colors image specified URL returns data frame hex codes RGB values. required parameters img_url, tolerance, limit, force_return_limit optional parameter. Parameters:img_url : character string representing image URLlimit : maximum number colors returned example , extract 2 prominent colors example image .
code: colours_df <-    get_color_palette("https://raw.githubusercontent.com/UBC-MDS/colourpycker/add_image/images/UBC_Aerial.jpg",                     3) colours_df #> # A tibble: 3 × 6 #>     red green  blue hex     col_freq col_share #>   <int> <int> <int> <chr>      <int>     <dbl> #> 1   107   159   181 #6B9FB5     2890  0.00103  #> 2   100   125   156 #647D9C     1462  0.000522 #> 3     0    10     0 #000A00      555  0.000198

title: colourpickr-vignette
text: function creates donut chart information common colors linked image. user specifies image, number colors, specifies size resulting chart. Parameters:img_url : string url image want pull colors fromnum_clrs : int number colors want pull imageplot_show : TRUE print plot, default TRUE example , plot donut chart color composition image.

title: colourpickr-vignette
text: function creates scatterplot using colours selected image based data set users choosing. Parameters:img_url URL image filedataset data.frame tibblex unquoted column name plot x-axis data data.frame tibbley unquoted column name plot y-axis data data.frame tibblecolour unquoted column name plot colour data data.frame tibble example , visualize scatter plot palmerpenguins data set colors extracted image.
code: plot <- scatterplot(    "https://raw.githubusercontent.com/UBC-MDS/colourpycker/add_image/images/UBC_Aerial.jpg",    palmerpenguins::penguins,    bill_length_mm,    body_mass_g,    species  ) plot #> Warning: Removed 2 rows containing missing values (`geom_point()`).

title: colourpickr-vignette
text: function extracts common colours image (via URL) inverts retrieve negative version colour palette, returning associated HEX codes RGB values colour. Parameters:img_url : character string representing image URLlimit : maximum number colors returned example , extract 2 prominent colors example image invert .
code: url <- "https://raw.githubusercontent.com/UBC-MDS/colourpycker/add_image/images/UBC_Aerial.jpg" negative(url, 3) #> # A tibble: 3 × 4 #>     red green  blue hex     #>   <dbl> <dbl> <dbl> <chr>   #> 1   148    96    74 #94604A #> 2   155   130    99 #9B8263 #> 3   255   245   255 #FFF5FF

title: Extract Colours For Data Visualization
text: package allows users integrate unique colour palettes graphs exploratory data analysis. colours retrieved image data (via URL) selected based overall prominence picture. existing tools used process images create figures independently, aim combine functionalities help programmers easily design effective creative visualizations.

title: Extract Colours For Data Visualization
text: exist similar functions R provide similar functionality package. packages capable colour extraction data visualization, none exist combine two functions knowledge. examples packages follows: Magick: allows extract colours image quantity colour image. However, convert colour palette, package data visualization capabilities built . Colorfindr: , allows extract colours image quantity colour image. However, convert colour palette, package data visualization capabilities built . paletteR: package allows create colour palette image. However, image must saved locally, URL, requires call GGPlot anothe package graph. Imgpalr: package allows create qualitative, sequential divergent color palettes image. , function data visualization built .

title: Extract Colours For Data Visualization
text: can install development version colourpickr GitHub :

title: Extract Colours For Data Visualization
text: get_color_palette(img_url, limit): function extracts common colors image returns data frame hex color codes RGB values. user provided ability set number colors returned. donut(img_url, num_clrs, plot_show): function creates donut chart information common colors linked image. user specifies image, number colors, specifies whether show plot . scatterplot(url_img, dataset, x, y, colour): function creates simple scatterplot using colours selected image based dataset users choosing. negative(img_url, num_colours): function extracts common n colours image (via URL) inverts retrieve negative version colour palette, returning associated HEX codes RGB values colour.
